page.title: 19LOCAL BUILDINGS
page.content:
{THE OLD SCHOOL ROOM}built in l870, was the village school until 1913. It is now used regularly for Parish Council, Sports Club, Youth Group and Community Council Meetings. It is also used for children's parties, choir practice and speech and drama classes.
{PEASLAKE SPOTTISWOOD MEMORIAL HALL}was built in 1923 on land given by local landowners. It is run by a committee of thirteen members representing the regular users. It is much used for a variety of activities:- Women's Institute, Gardening Club, Jumble Sales, Welfare Clinic, Badminton. Cubs, Brownies and Boys' Brigades use the hall for group holidays. Peaslake Players rehearse there and present three plays each year.
